head.title: Introduction to Anatomy and Physiology Unit Review and Assessment

body.p: Before taking the quiz below, consider again the learning objectives for this unit on vital functions, body systems, body planes, and directional terms. Could you demonstrate your knowledge of each of these objectives? If so, you will be ready for the assessment. If not, consider reviewing content related to these objectives before attempting the assessment.

li.p: Identify those functions considered vital to human life and explain how organ systems contribute to these functions.
Identify the vital functions of human life that drive physiological processes.
Use body planes and directional orientation to describe the locations of body structures.

List the organ systems of the human body. For each system: (a) list the major organs or structures; (b) describe the major functions; and (c) use terms of anatomical plane and reference to identify parts of organ systems with relation to one another.
